blade_and_sword.summary: The most common weapons. Sword (Geom) is for gentlemen, Saber (Do) is for soldiers/bandits.

list.name: 단검 (Dagger / 短劍)
list.usage: Close combat, assassination, secondary weapon for women/Haomun.

list.name: 금도 (Gold Saber / 金刀)
list.usage: Wealthy young masters. Show-off weapon made of gold.

list.name: 귀두도 (Ghost Head Saber / 鬼頭刀)
list.usage: Bandits/Executers. Heavy, blunt tip, ghost head decoration on hilt.

list.name: 면도 (Soft Saber / 緬刀)
list.usage: Flexible blade like a belt. Hard to master, unpredictable trajectory.

list.name: 계도 (Precept Saber / 戒刀)
list.usage: Shaolin Monks. Used to cut earthly ties/vines, not kill (ideally).

list.name: 연검 (Soft Sword / 軟劍)
list.usage: Wrapped around the waist. Requires internal energy to straighten.

list.name: 강도 (Steel Saber / 鋼刀)
list.usage: Hebei Peng Family. Heavy and durable.

polearms_and_blunt.summary: Weapons for heavy impact or reach. Favored by Shaolin, Beggars, and Bandits.

list.name: 봉 & 곤 (Staff & Cudgel / 棒 & 棍)
list.usage: Beggars (Dog Beating Staff), Shaolin (Monk Staff). Non-lethal crushing.

list.name: 타구봉 (Dog Beating Staff / 打狗棒)
list.usage: Symbol of the Beggar Sect Leader. Used to hit 'dogs' (enemies).

list.name: 낭아봉 (Wolf Tooth Mace / 狼牙棒)
list.usage: Brute force. Covered in spikes like wolf teeth. Inflicts severe trauma.

list.name: 선장 (Zen Staff / 禪杖)
list.usage: Shaolin Monks. Often has rings that jingle to warn insects/animals.

list.name: 창 (Spear / 長槍)
list.usage: Military/General. King of Hundred Weapons. Penetration focused.

list.name: 철퇴 (Iron Hammer / 鐵槌)
list.usage: Crushing armor.

exotic_and_scholar.summary: Weapons for specialists, scholars, or eccentrics.

list.name: 부채 (Fan / 扇)
list.usage: Scholars/Strategists (Zhuge). Iron ribs, hidden blades, or wind attacks.

list.name: 판관필 & 철필 (Judge's Pen & Iron Brush / 判官筆 & 鐵筆)
list.usage: Scholars. Used for sealing acupoints (Jeom-hyeol).

list.name: 철주판 (Iron Abacus / 鐵珠板)
list.usage: Merchants/Strategists. Beads are shot as projectiles.

list.name: 편 (Whip / 鞭) & 연편 (Soft Whip)
list.usage: Women or cruel masters. Long reach, entangling.

list.name: 륜 (Chakram/Wheel / 輪)
list.usage: Rotating bladed wheels. Thrown or held.

list.name: 유성추 (Meteor Hammer / 流星鎚)
list.usage: Ball on a chain. High centrifugal force.

list.name: 혈적자 (Blood Guillotine / 血摘刺)
list.usage: Flying guillotine. Captures the head and decapitates. Fear factor: Max.

hidden_weapons.summary: Projectiles used for surprise attacks. Sichuan Tang Family specialty.

list.name: 비표 & 표창 (Throwing Star/Knife)
list.usage: Standard projectile.

list.name: 비황석 (Flying Locust Stone / 飛蝗石)
list.usage: Shaped like locusts. Blunt trauma.

list.name: 매화수전 (Plum Blossom Sleeve Arrow / 梅花手箭)
list.usage: Spring-loaded or wrist-flick mechanism. Hidden in sleeves.

list.name: 수노 (Hand Crossbow / 手弩)
list.usage: Mechanical repeating crossbow.

list.name: 독질려 (Poison Caltrop / 毒疾藜)
list.usage: Spiked caltrops on the floor to stop pursuit. Poisoned.

list.name: 단혼사 (Soul Severing Sand / 斷魂沙)
list.usage: Poison sand. Creates a cloud of pain.

list.name: 만천화우 (Sky Filled with Flower Rain / 滿天花雨)
list.usage: The ultimate hidden weapon technique. Filling the sky with unavoidable projectiles.

list: 분수도/분수자 (Water Parting Blade/Spike) - For underwater combat.

narrative_role: Characterization: A scholar with a fan looks elegant; a bandit with a wolf tooth mace looks brutal.
Tactical Variety: Whip vs Sword (Reach vs Speed), Hammer vs Shield (Crush vs Block).
Surprise Factor: The 'Merchant' suddenly shooting beads from his abacus.
